definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

sentences.english: Liu xuan to the snack bar to find cloves, learned that jade beads back.
sentences.chinese: 刘璇到小吃店去找丁香，得知玉珠回城了。

sentences.english: One group even set up a school snack shop.
sentences.chinese: 一个小组甚至建立了一个学校小吃店。

sentences.english: An electric fan twirls. Cantonese music on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 小吃店白天，电扇转，广东音乐。

sentences.english: Let's go the snack bar and see what they have.
sentences.chinese: 我们去小吃店看看他们有什么可吃的。

sentences.english: Visitors can enjoy various foods in snack bars in the Expo Park.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以在世博园的小吃店品尝各种食品。

sentences.english: A Chinese man eats a snack outside a food shop in Beijing, China. (March 22, 2011) (Andy Wong/Associated Press)
sentences.chinese: 北京，一个老汉在小吃店外面吃点心。

sentences.english: There is a new snack bar near our school gate , let's go and have a try.
sentences.chinese: 我们校门口附近新开了一家小吃店，我们去试试。

sentences.english: Everyone knows that service in this snack bar is very poor.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都知道这家小吃店的服务不好。

sentences.english: By day, you are a mild-mannered delicatessen owner from New York.
sentences.chinese: 白天，你是来自纽约的性情温和的小吃店业主。

sentences.english: She opened a snack bar in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 她在附近地区开了一家小吃店。

definition: hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
